ai-sn40:1.1.1_0: At one time Venerable Mahāmoggallāna was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
ai-sn40:1.1.2_0: There Venerable Mahāmoggallāna addressed the mendicants:
ai-sn40:1.2.1_0: “Just now, reverends, as I was in private retreat this thought came to mind:
ai-sn40:1.2.2_0: ‘They speak of this thing called the “first absorption”.
ai-sn40:1.2.4_0: Then this, friend, occurred to me:
ai-sn40:1.2.5_0: ‘It’s when a mendicant, quite secluded from sensual pleasures, secluded from unskillful qualities, enters and remains in the first absorption, which has the rapture and bliss born of seclusion, while placing the mind and keeping it connected.
ai-sn40:1.2.6_0: This is called the first absorption.’
ai-sn40:1.2.7_0: And so ... I was entering and remaining in the first absorption.
ai-sn40:1.2.8_0: While I was in that meditation, perceptions and attentions accompanied by sensual pleasures beset me.
ai-sn40:1.3.1_0: Then the Buddha came up to me with his psychic power and said,
ai-sn40:1.3.3_0: Don’t neglect the first absorption, brahmin! Settle your mind in the first absorption; unify your mind and immerse it in the first absorption.’
ai-sn40:1.3.4_0: And so, after some time ... I entered and remained in the first absorption.
ai-sn40:1.3.5_0: For if anyone should be rightly called
ai-sn40:1.3.6_0: a disciple who attained to great direct knowledge with help from the Teacher, it’s me.”
ai-sn40:1.3.7_0: ‘Now a disciple who attained to great direct knowledge with great wisdom.’”
ai-sn40:2.1.1_0: “They speak of this thing called the 'second absorption'.
ai-sn40:2.1.3_0: Then this, friend, occurred to me:
ai-sn40:2.1.4_0: ‘As the placing of the mind and keeping it connected are stilled, a mendicant enters and remains in the second absorption, which has the rapture and bliss born of immersion, with internal clarity and confidence, and unified mind, without placing the mind and keeping it connected.
ai-sn40:2.1.5_0: This is called the second absorption.’
ai-sn40:2.1.6_0: And so ... I was entering and remaining in the second absorption.
ai-sn40:2.1.7_0: While I was in that meditation, perceptions and attentions accompanied by placing the mind beset me.
ai-sn40:2.2.1_0: Then the Buddha came up to me with his psychic power and said,
ai-sn40:2.2.3_0: Don’t neglect the second absorption, brahmin! Settle your mind in the second absorption; unify your mind and immerse it in the second absorption.’
ai-sn40:2.2.4_0: And so, after some time ... I entered and remained in the second absorption.
ai-sn40:2.2.5_0: For if anyone should be rightly called
ai-sn40:2.2.6_0: a disciple who attained to great direct knowledge with help from the Teacher, it’s me.”
ai-sn40:2.2.7_0: ‘Now a disciple who attained to great direct knowledge with great wisdom.’”
ai-sn40:3.1.1_0: “They speak of this thing called the ‘third absorption’.
ai-sn40:3.1.4_0: ‘With the fading away of rapture, a mendicant enters and remains in the third absorption, where they meditate with equanimity, mindful and aware, personally experiencing the bliss of which the noble ones declare, “Equanimous and mindful, one meditates in bliss.”
ai-sn40:3.1.4_1: ‘One is even-minded, mindful, and abides in bliss.’
ai-sn40:3.1.5_0: This is called the third absorption.’
ai-sn40:3.1.6_0: And so ... I was staying equanimous, mindful and aware.
ai-sn40:3.1.6_1: about which the Noble Ones declare:
ai-sn40:3.1.6_2: ‘One is even-minded, mindful, and abides in bliss.’
ai-sn40:3.1.7_0: While I was in that meditation, perceptions and attentions accompanied by rapture beset me.
ai-sn40:3.2.1_0: Then the Buddha came up to me with his psychic power and said,
ai-sn40:3.2.3_0: Don’t neglect the third absorption, brahmin! Settle your mind in the third absorption; unify your mind and immerse it in the third absorption.’
ai-sn40:3.2.4_0: And so, after some time ... I was staying equanimous, mindful and aware.
ai-sn40:3.2.4_1: ‘One is even-minded, mindful, and abides in bliss.’
ai-sn40:3.2.5_0: For if anyone should be rightly called a great direct knowledge, I attained the direct knowledge, and the emptiness.”
ai-sn40:4.1.1_0: “They speak of this thing called the ‘third absorption’.
ai-sn40:4.1.3_0: Then this, friend, occurred to me:
ai-sn40:4.1.4_0: ‘It’s when, giving up pleasure and pain, and ending former happiness and sadness, a mendicant enters and remains in the fourth absorption, without pleasure or pain, with pure equanimity and mindfulness.
ai-sn40:4.1.5_0: This is called the fourth absorption.’
ai-sn40:4.1.6_0: And so ... I was entering and remaining in the fourth absorption.
ai-sn40:4.1.7_0: While I was in that meditation, perceptions and attentions accompanied by pleasure beset me.
ai-sn40:4.2.1_0: Then the Buddha came up to me with his psychic power and said,
ai-sn40:4.2.3_0: Don’t neglect the fourth absorption, brahmin! Settle your mind in the fourth absorption; unify your mind and immerse it in the fourth absorption.’
ai-sn40:4.2.4_0: And so, after some time ... I entered and remained in the fourth absorption.
ai-sn40:4.2.5_0: For if anyone should be rightly called a great direct knowledge, I attained the direct knowledge, and the emptiness.”
ai-sn40:5.1.1_0: “They speak of this thing called the ‘dimension of infinite space’.
ai-sn40:5.1.2_0: What is the dimension of infinite space?
ai-sn40:5.1.3_0: Then this, friend, occurred to me:
ai-sn40:5.1.4_0: ‘It’s when a mendicant—going totally beyond perceptions of form, with the ending of perceptions of impingement, not focusing on perceptions of diversity—aware that “space is infinite”, enters and remains in the dimension of infinite space.
ai-sn40:5.1.5_0: This is called the dimension of infinite space.’
ai-sn40:5.1.6_0: And so ... I was entering and remaining in the dimension of infinite space.
ai-sn40:5.1.7_0: While I was in that meditation, perceptions and attentions accompanied by forms beset me.
ai-sn40:5.2.1_0: Then the Buddha came up to me with his psychic power and said,
ai-sn40:5.2.3_0: Don’t neglect the dimension of infinite space, brahmin! Settle your mind in the dimension of infinite space; unify your mind and immerse it in the dimension of infinite space.’
ai-sn40:5.2.4_0: And so, after some time ... I entered and remained in the dimension of infinite space.
ai-sn40:5.2.5_0: For if anyone should be rightly called a great direct knowledge, I attained the direct knowledge, and the emptiness.”
ai-sn40:6.1.1_0: “They speak of this thing called the ‘dimension of infinite consciousness’.
ai-sn40:6.1.2_0: What is the dimension of infinite consciousness?
ai-sn40:6.1.3_0: Then this, friend, occurred to me:
ai-sn40:6.1.4_0: ‘It’s when a mendicant, going totally beyond the dimension of infinite space, aware that “consciousness is infinite”, enters and remains in the dimension of infinite consciousness.
ai-sn40:6.1.5_0: This is called the dimension of infinite consciousness.’
ai-sn40:6.1.6_0: And so ... I was entering and remaining in the dimension of infinite consciousness.
ai-sn40:6.1.7_0: While I was in that meditation, perceptions and attentions accompanied by the dimension of infinite space beset me.
ai-sn40:6.2.1_0: Then the Buddha came up to me with his psychic power and said,
ai-sn40:6.2.3_0: Don’t neglect the dimension of infinite consciousness, brahmin! Settle your mind in the dimension of infinite consciousness!’
ai-sn40:6.2.4_0: And so, after some time ... I entered and remained in the dimension of infinite consciousness.
ai-sn40:6.2.5_0: For if anyone should be rightly called a great direct knowledge, I attained the direct knowledge, and the emptiness.”
ai-sn40:6.2.6_0: The sixth offering to an individual.
ai-sn40:7.1.1_0: “They speak of this thing called the ‘dimension of nothingness’.
ai-sn40:7.1.2_0: What is the dimension of nothingness?
ai-sn40:7.1.3_0: Then this, friend, occurred to me:
ai-sn40:7.1.4_0: ‘It’s when a mendicant, going totally beyond the dimension of infinite consciousness, aware that “there is nothing at all”, enters and remains in the dimension of nothingness.
ai-sn40:7.1.5_0: This is called the dimension of nothingness.’
ai-sn40:7.1.6_0: And so ... I was entering and remaining in the dimension of nothingness.
ai-sn40:7.1.7_0: While I was in that meditation, perceptions and attentions accompanied by the dimension of infinite consciousness beset me.
ai-sn40:7.2.1_0: Then the Buddha came up to me with his psychic power and said,
ai-sn40:7.2.3_0: Don’t neglect the dimension of nothingness, brahmin! Settle your mind in the dimension of nothingness; unify your mind and immerse it in the dimension of nothingness.’
ai-sn40:7.2.4_0: And so, after some time ... I entered and remained in the dimension of nothingness.
ai-sn40:7.2.5_0: For if anyone should be rightly called a great direct knowledge, I attained the direct knowledge, and the emptiness.”
ai-sn40:8.0.3_0: A Question About the Dimension of Neither Perception
ai-sn40:8.1.1_0: “They speak of this thing called the ‘dimension of neither perception nor non-perception’.
ai-sn40:8.1.2_0: What is the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception?
ai-sn40:8.1.3_0: Then this, friend, occurred to me:
ai-sn40:8.1.4_0: ‘It’s when a mendicant, going totally beyond the dimension of nothingness, enters and remains in the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception.
ai-sn40:8.1.5_0: This is called the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception.’
ai-sn40:8.1.6_0: And so ... I was entering and remaining in the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception.
ai-sn40:8.1.7_0: While I was in that meditation, perceptions and attentions accompanied by the dimension of nothingness beset me.
ai-sn40:8.2.1_0: Then the Buddha came up to me with his psychic power and said,
ai-sn40:8.2.3_0: Don’t neglect the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception, brahmin! Settle your mind in the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception; unify your mind and immerse it in the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception.’
ai-sn40:8.2.4_0: And so, after some time ... I entered and remained in the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception.
ai-sn40:8.2.5_0: For if anyone should be rightly called a great direct knowledge, I attained the direct knowledge, and the emptiness.”
ai-sn40:9.1.1_0: “They speak of this thing called the ‘signless immersion of the heart’.
ai-sn40:9.1.2_0: What is the signless immersion of the heart?
ai-sn40:9.1.3_0: Then this, friend, occurred to me:
ai-sn40:9.1.4_0: ‘It’s when a mendicant, not focusing on any signs, enters and remains in the signless immersion of the heart.
ai-sn40:9.1.5_0: This is called the signless immersion of the heart.’
ai-sn40:9.1.6_0: And so ... I was entering and remaining in the signless immersion of the heart.
ai-sn40:9.1.7_0: While I was in that meditation, my consciousness followed after signs.
ai-sn40:9.2.1_0: Then the Buddha came up to me with his psychic power and said,
ai-sn40:9.2.3_0: Don’t neglect the signless immersion of the heart, brahmin! Settle your mind in the signless immersion of the heart; unify your mind and immerse it in the signless immersion of the heart.’
ai-sn40:9.2.4_0: And so, after some time ... I entered and remained in the signless immersion of the heart.
ai-sn40:9.2.5_0: For if anyone should be rightly called
ai-sn40:9.2.6_0: a disciple who attained to great direct knowledge with help from the Teacher, it’s me.”
ai-sn40:9.2.7_0: ‘Now a disciple who attained to great direct knowledge with great wisdom.’”
ai-sn40:10.1.1_0: Then Venerable Mahāmoggallāna, as easily as a strong person would extend or contract their arm, vanished from Jeta’s Grove and reappeared in the presence of the Buddha.
